steps.title: Welcome!
paragraphs: Welcome to Nextcloud's dashboard.
Would you like to follow a short tutorial to learn how to use Nextcloud?
You can find the recent activities of your Nextcloud server on the dashboard.
The recommended files section shows this Nextcloud's recently created or modified files.
The upcoming events are the events on the calendars you have access to.
Click 'Customize' to add or remove elements to the Dashbboard.
This will only affect your Nextcloud interface. It won't have any effect on other users!
Find this Nextcloud's installed apps here.
You logged in with a user name and password. You can find your profile here.
Change your account's personal information here.
You can find every available tutorial by clicking on the 'intros' button.
You can enable or disable the tutorial of any app with this menu.

steps.title: See you!
paragraphs: This is the end of this app's tutorial.
You can follow other apps' tutorials with the following buttons:

steps.title: Welcome!
paragraphs: Welcome to the tutorial of the files app, the core of your Nextcloud experience!
You can find all your files and folders at the center of this page.
The 'new' button allows you to add new elements to your Nextcloud server.
Upload a file from your computer…
… or create a file or folder from the Nextcloud interface right away.
Some shortcuts are available on the side, including the recent files and the deleted files.
Click on the three dots to interact with the selected file or folder.
Files and folders aren't shared by default, but you can share them publicly or to this Nextcloud's users.
Click on the share button to find out more about the sharing options after this tutorial is over.

steps.title: See you!
paragraphs: This is the end of this app's tutorial.
You can follow other apps' tutorials with the following buttons:

steps.title: Sharing files
paragraphs: Welcome to the file sharing tutorial.
You can create an internal sharing link to share a file or folder to this Nextcloud's other users.
This link will only be accessible to people who have an account on this Nextcloud server !
You can also create a public link to share a file or folder to anyone on the Internet. You can choose whether they can only see the resource, or modify it as well.
To share a file or folder via e-mail, provide the e-mail address of the person you want to share this file or folder to, and choose their permissions on the resource.

steps.title: See you!
paragraphs: This is the end of this tutorial.

steps.title: Welcome!
paragraphs: This section gives you access to your personal information.
Your profile is always accessible in the top-right corner. You can access your personal information from there.
You can change your name, profile picture or language in the 'personal info' section.
The 'security' section allows you to change your password.
Define whether you want to receive e-mails when something is happening on this Nextcloud in the 'notifications' section.

steps.title: See you!
paragraphs: This is the end of this app's tutorial.

steps.title: Welcome!
paragraphs: Organize your events in the calendar app.
The central calendar shows all the events that are shared with you or that you have created yourself.
You can change the period's length in this menu.
The 'Today' button centers the calendar on the current day, week or month.
Calendars you have access to (created by you or shared to you) are available here.
Create a new calendar to add it to the list with this button.
You can edit a calendar by clicking on the pencil icon.
You can share a calendar with another user, a group or via a public link.
You can create a new event and add it to a calendar here.
You can import events from another calendar (e.g. from a .ics file) with the 'import calendar' button in the calendar settings.

steps.title: Welcome!
paragraphs: Store your personal contacts in the Contacts app. Other users won't have access to them by default.
Click here to add a contact.
You can also import a set of contacts from another application in the Contacts settings.
Organize your contacts with Contacts groups.
These are your groups, they are not public.
With Circles, create groups of people whom you can share data with.
Circles are public within this Nextcloud server.

steps.title: Welcome!
paragraphs: The Talk app allows you to chat or video call with others in Nextcloud.
Find your existing conversations here.
Create a new group chat with this button.
You can also choose to chat with someone by searching their name in the search bar.
